fileheader.constant: const SCRIPTOPT_NO_INTERRUPT := 1; // if 1, script runs until it sleeps
const SCRIPTOPT_DEBUG := 2; // if 1, prints any debug info included
const SCRIPTOPT_NO_RUNAWAY := 3; // if 1, doesn't warn about runaway conditions

function.name: GetProcess

parameter.name: pid
parameter.value: Integer process ID of a script

function.explain: Gets a script process object for the given script's PID.

function.name: Getpid
function.explain: Returns the Process ID for this script.

function.name: Unload_Scripts

parameter.name: scriptname
parameter.value: String filename of script without extension (optional)

function.explain: unload scripts from the script cache (they will be reloaded from disk on demand) currently running scripts will continue as normal.
Passing "" will unload all scripts.

function.name: Set_Script_Option
function.explain: Sets one or more options on or off for this script

Constants for this function:
const SCRIPTOPT_NO_INTERRUPT := 1; // if 1, script runs until it sleeps const SCRIPTOPT_DEBUG := 2; // if 1, prints any debug info included const SCRIPTOPT_NO_RUNAWAY := 3; // if 1, doesn't warn about runaway conditions const SCRIPTOPT_CAN_ACCESS_OFFLINE_MOBILES := 4;
set_script_option(SCRIPTOPT_NO_INTERRUPT,1) is the same as set_critical(1)
set_script_option(SCRIPTOPT_DEBUG,1) is the same as set_debug(1)

function.name: Sleep
function.explain: Puts the current script to sleep for num_seconds. No further instructions in this script will be processed in this script until the time expires.
DO NOT USE IN A CRITICAL BLOCK! Your server will freeze for the duration!
If this script is attached to a character (like a UseScript), calling detach() before the sleep will allow other scripts to run while this script sleeps.

function.name: Sleepms
function.explain: Puts the current script to sleep for num_milliseconds. No further instructions in this script will be processed in this script until the time expires.
DO NOT USE IN A CRITICAL BLOCK! Your server will freeze for the duration!
If this script is attached to a character (like a UseScript), calling detach() before the sleep will allow other scripts to run while this script sleeps.
You're not likely to get any faster resolution than 10ms

function.name: Wait_For_Event
function.explain: The primary access to a script's event queue. If there is an event waiting, the function immediately returns with the event (could be a string, int, struct, etc).
If no event is waiting, the script sleeps for num_seconds_timeout or until a new event arrives. If the timeout is reached, the function returns 0.
if timeout is 0, returns immediately
function.return: object on event recv, 0 on timeout

function.name: Events_Waiting
function.explain: Returns the number of events waiting in the event queue for this script.

function.name: Set_Priority
function.explain: the priority of a script is how many instructions it executes before switching to another script.
default script priority is 1.

function.name: Set_Critical
function.explain: critical scripts run if they are not blocked, without interruption.
An infinite loop in a critical script will hang the server
Use this in blocks by setting 'critical' to 1 before the critical code and to 0 after it.
Use this function sparingly, only in parts of code that must execute without interruption

function.name: Set_Debug
function.explain: if debug=1, and the script was compiled with 'ecompile -i [script].src', each script source line will be printed as it is executed.
if debug=0, disables this output.

function.name: Start_Script

parameter.name: script_name
parameter.value: String name and path of script to run

parameter.name: param
parameter.value: object to pass to the script. Only one param may be passed. (optional)

function.explain: Starts a new script running.
Tip: write your script to expect a struct or array as its only parameter, so you may pass multiple pieces of data through the struct or array.
function.return: A Script object for the started script on success.

function.name: Run_Script

parameter.name: script_name
parameter.value: String name and path of script to run

parameter.name: param
parameter.value: object to pass to the script. Only one param may be passed. (optional)

function.explain: Starts a new NON-CRITICAL script. Runs until the script exits, returns the return value of the started script.
Tip: write your script to expect a struct or array as its only parameter, so you may pass multiple pieces of data through the struct or array.
function.return: The return value of the started script, or 1 if no value was returned

function.name: Run_Script_To_Completion

parameter.name: script_name
parameter.value: String name and path of script to run

parameter.name: param
parameter.value: object to pass to the script. Only one param may be passed. (optional)

function.explain: Starts a new CRITICAL script. Runs until the script exits, returns the return value of the started script.
Tip: write your script to expect a struct or array as its only parameter, so you may pass multiple pieces of data through the struct or array.
Every 1000 instructions, "Script X running.." is printed to the console
function.return: The return value of the started script, or 1 if no value was returned

function.name: Syslog
function.explain: write text to the console, and to the log file includes context (calling script name)

function.name: System_RPM
function.explain: returns the system RPM, which is the number of "game loop rotations" completed in the last minute.

function.name: Clear_Event_Queue
function.explain: Empties the current script's event queue

function.name: OpenURL
function.explain: Sends an Open URL packet to the client, to open the url in their Default Browser.

function.name: Set_Event_Queue_Size
function.explain: Changes the maximum number of events the current script will keep in the queue (additional events will be discarded).
If not called, the default size is 20 events.

function.name: Create_Debug_Context
function.explain: TBD

function.name: Is_Critical
function.explain: Returns true if the script is critical (by using set_critical())
